title: Projects
text:
Time Series Predictive Modeling of 5G Core Traffic
University of Granada, Dec. 2025

Designed a reproducible forecasting methodology for live 5G Core traffic using ARIMA, Prophet, and XGBoost
Modeled short-term traffic dynamics linking PCF signalling load to optimal discrete resource allocation
Conducted rolling-window validation and model benchmarking
Selected XGBoost based on the accuracy-complexity trade-off

title: Projects

title: Jesús Blanco Molina
text: I am a B.Sc. Mathematics student and Cyber Defense Engineer based in Leipzig, Germany. My work combines statistical learning, time-series forecasting, and security-focused data analysis in large-scale distributed systems.

title: Jesús Blanco Molina
text:
Technical Skills

Programming & Systems: Python (PyTorch, NumPy, scikit-learn, pandas), MATLAB, PowerShell, Linux, Kubernetes
Machine Learning & Modeling: Gradient boosting, stochastic processes, exploratory data analysis, feature analysis, model benchmarking
Scientific Writing & Communication: LaTeX, technical documentation, presentation of results to interdisciplinary teams (EN / DE / ES)
Languages: Spanish (native), German (TELC C1 Hochschule), English (TOEIC B2)
